qas.question: What policies did a State Department official accuse UNFPA of helping China carry out?
What was this official's position at the time?
Who was the official that accused UNFPA?
What was UNFPA accused of contributing to the Chinese program?
What papers reported on this incident?

answers.text: the Washington Post and the Washington Times

qas.question: What policies did a State Department official accuse UNFPA of not helping China carry out?
Who was the official that was part of UNFPA?
What was UNFPA accused of taking away from the Chinese program?

plausible_answers.text: the Washington Post and the Washington Times

qas.question: What papers denied to report on this incident?

context: However, according to then-<a1_0>Secretary of State<a1_0/> <a2_0><b6_0>Colin Powell<b6_0/><a2_0/>, the UNFPA contributed <a3_0><b7_0>vehicles and computers<b7_0/><a3_0/> to the Chinese to carry out their <a0_0><b5_0>population control policies<b5_0/><a0_0/>. However, both <a4_0><b8_0>the Washington Post and the Washington Times<b8_0/><a4_0/> reported that Powell simply fell in line, signing a brief written by someone else.
